text:
I'm still getting these perpetual cancel loops, which occur when a bet is (presumably) matched after I've sent the cancel request:

text: Just trying to test some cancelling order code and I think im either not preparing the test correct or theres a gap in my knowledge to how the simulated stuff works (most likely both!). The test creates an order, status goes from PENDING -> EXECUTABLE. I then try and cancel that order and the status goes from CANCELLING back to EXECUTABLE (is that correct?). I can see in responses there is a simulated cancel response with a full cancel, yet I cant see any current order ? order size remaining stays at the place amount I think due to the current order still returning self.responses.place_response as self.responses.current_order is None. whats the expected order status flow behaviour here and should there be a current_order response?

elements.text: Just trying to test some cancelling order code and I think im either not preparing the test correct or theres a gap in my knowledge to how the simulated stuff works (most likely both!). The test creates an order, status goes from PENDING -> EXECUTABLE. I then try and cancel that order and the status goes from CANCELLING back to EXECUTABLE (is that correct?). I can see in responses there is a simulated cancel response with a full cancel, yet I cant see any current order ? order size remaining stays at the place amount I think due to the current order still returning self.responses.place_response as self.responses.current_order is None. whats the expected order status flow behaviour here and should there be a current_order response?
